summary:
PROFESSIONAL SUMMARY

Multi-disciplinary expert who has for 20 years implemented technologically advanced analytical tools to meet customer needs in life science research.  
10 years of comprehensive expertise in advancing programs through both early and late-stage development with commercialization of antibody-drug conjugate (ADC) targeted therapeutics.
Program manager responsible for late-phase drug development, regulatory support (IND and BLA filings), and client relations.  
5 years of experience working in a regulatory environment - extensive knowledge of planning, designing, and implementing new analytical cGMP/GLP processes and procedures.  
Experienced manager with a passion for quality and customer service and the ability to work in a diverse, highly matrixed, and fast-paced environment. 
Knowledgeable in R&D, contract manufacturing operations, project management, technical services, product management, and procurement.

SKILL HIGHLIGHTS

Leadership 
Supervised teams of up to ten analysts; provided technical training and mentoring to direct reports; deliberative and structured approach to ensure department-wide efficiencies; efficient communicator and outstanding motivator. 

Organizational and Laboratory Management 
Superior technical writing skills; authored high quality instructions for user manuals and operating procedures; ability to flawlessly handle multiple projects; proficient in the oversight of work output and safety of employees; capable of working independently or in a team setting composed of diverse groups and situations.

Process Improvement 
Plan Do Study Act (PDSA), 5S, value stream mapping, gemba, root cause analysis, and design of experiment (DOE) initiatives spanning multiple departments both in a leadership role and as a team participant.

Bioanalytical Chemistry 
Method development, qualification, and validation of characterization and chromatography assays for the support of all phases of ADC product development.

ingestedContentSummary.title: Exploring New Possibilities with 3D Printing of Pharmaceuticals

message.text:
Discover this Q&A, where Thomas Kipping, Ph.D., Head of 3D Printing and Solubility Enhancement, sheds light on the evolution, current state, and future prospects of 3D printing in pharma, in conversation with Pharma’s Almanac's to discuss the topic of additive manufacturing, commonly known as 3D printing, and how it is reshaping pharmaceutical manufacturing.

Unlike traditional oral solid dose (OSD) manufacturing, 3D printing offers unparalleled flexibility in designing drug prototypes, final dosage forms enabling precision dosing and the creation of complex release kinetics. This technology is especially valuable during early R&D, for creating innovative dosage forms and streamlining the supply of clinical trial material. Our raw materials portfolio plays a leading role in the 3D printing space, establishing collaborations and developing products to realize the potential of additive manufacturing. #solidformulation #formulation #osd #drugdevelopment

ingestedContentSummary.title: Enhancing API Solubility During API Processing and Formulation Development MilliporeSigma

message.text:
Understanding the impact of API solubility on the performance of a given drug product and determining ways to enhance dissolution rates is critical to ensuring your product makes it to market, into the hands of patients and clinicians, is well absorbed and provides its intended therapeutic effect. Selecting the best formulation strategy to address challenges for each API, however, can be time-consuming, costly and complex.

Discover our ebook on Solubility Enhancement in solid and liquid formulation and learn more about:
- Considerations during early stages of drug development
- Recommendations to address obstacles pertaining to API stability and bioavailability
- Processing methods available to enhance APIs and optimize formulations
#solubilityenhancement #formulation #drugdevelopment

ingestedContentSummary.title: Unleashing the Potential for Polyvinyl Alcohol in Spray Drying for Oral Solid Dosage Forms

message.text:
Discover the benefits of using polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) and how it can be applied in spray drying for oral solid dosage forms. During this webinar, you will learn how this versatile polymer stabilizes small molecules, both traditional and emerging (e.g. PROTACs), and how it enhances their solubility.
Register for our webinar now!
#solidformulation #formulation #osd #drugdevelopment
